intro: Ossaea hirtella, commonly known as the hairy ossaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation. Ossaea hirtella is adapted to dry conditions and is an important component of its native ecosystem.
